name: Thin crust Margherita
method: Put the flour into a large bowl, then stir in the yeast and salt. Make a well, pour in olive oil and warm water  and bring together with a wooden spoon until you have a soft, fairly wet dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 mins until smooth. Cover with a tea towel and set aside
Mix basil crushed garlic and passata,together, then season to taste. Leave to stand at room temperature while you get on with shaping the base
Give the dough a quick knead and than on n a floured surface roll it out into large thin rounds, about 25cm across. Lift the rounds onto greasing paper
Heat oven to 240C/fan 220C /gas 8. Smooth sauce over base. Scatter with Parmesan and Mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 8 - 10 mins until crisp
Serve with a little more olive oil, and basil leaves

name: Prosciutto and spinach tortellini
method: Cook pasta according to the package directions, omitting salt and fat. Drain and transfer to a large bowl
Heat a large frying pan over medium heat. Add nuts, cook until toasted (1 - 1/2 minutes), stir occasionally. Move nuts to bowl
Give the dough a quick knead and than on n a floured surface roll it out into large thin rounds, about 25cm across. Lift the rounds onto greasing paper
Heat oil in the pan, add garlic and cook 1 minute, constantly stirring. Add spinach to pan, and cook for 2 more minutes or until spinach wilts
Add spinach mixture, cheese, and remaining ingredients to bowl, toss well
Serve seasoned with black pepper

name: Creamy polenta with mushroom ragout
method: Soak the dried porcini in warm water. In 20 mins drain and reserve the soaking liquid
In large saucepan mix milk and water, bring to boil, add bay leaf and thyme. Take off the heat and leave to infuse for 15 mins

Heat frying pan over medium heat, add butter, shallot and cook until soft. Turn up the heat and add garlic, thyme leaves, porcini and all the mushrooms. Fry over a very high heat for 5 mins until soft. Splash in the red wine and boil rapidly for another 1 min. Lower the heat to medium and pour in the stock and reserved mushroom liquid, simmer for 15 mins until the stew thickens. Take of the heat

Fish out the herbs from infused milk and bring it to boil. Add the polenta in a slow stream while whisking steadily. Cook for 5 min until thickened, then cover and cook over medium heat another 10 min. Stir in the butter and Parmesan
Serve seasoned with black pepper
Preheat the grill to 180 C (350F). Make a well of polenta and cover with the ragout. Top with slices of Taleggio, place under the grill until cheese starts melting (2 - 3 mins)

name: Meatball spaghetti
method: Preheat oven to 240C/fan 220C /gas 8. Mix all ingredients in a large bowl until evenly mixed. Roll 1,5 - 2 inches large meatballs. Transfer meatballs to oiled baking tray and bake for 15 minutes

Heat a large frying pan over medium heat. Add oil garlic, onion, fry until golden. Add chopped tomatoes, sugar, salt, paper and seasoning, cover and cook for 10 minutes. Add meatballs, cover and let meatballs simmer in sauce for 5 min for extra flavour
In a large pot bring water to boil. Add salt, olive oil and spaghetti. Boil on medium heat for 5 minutes, and than drain
Serve garnished with parmesan and basil

name: Walnut and wild rocket pesto Spaghetti
method: Place walnuts in one layer on a large microwavable plate, and microwave for 1 - 2 mins, till toasted
Put into a food processor with basil, rocket, Parmesan, olive oil and garlic. Process until smooth, season with salt to taste
In a large pot bring water to boil. Add salt, olive oil and pasta. Boil on medium heat for 5 minutes, and than drain
Mix pasta and pesto together in a large bowl
Serve garnished with parmesan and basil

name: Classic potato pancakes
method: Crush garlic in pestle and mortar (or press in to small bowl), than add warm water, olive oil and dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste, than set aside
Grate potatoes and onion thinly, drain excess liquid. In a large bowl beat the egg, than stir in all the rest of ingredients
Heat a large frying pan over high heat, add oil. Start forming thin pancakes, around 2 inches in diameter. Fry each side for 3 - 4 mins until golden
Drizzle with garlic sauce
Serve with extra garlic sauce and soured cream on the side

name: Macaroni po-flotski or navy style pasta
method: Place cooked pulled pork in a food processor or meet grinder and pulse for 1 min until nicely ground
Bring a pot of water to boil, add salt and olive oil, cook pasta according to the package instructions

Heat a large frying pan over medium heat, add butter, garlic and shallots, cook until the onions are tender and slightly golden. Add meat and mix with wooden spatula, cook until the edges of the pork are golden (5 - 8 min)
Add flour, mix until incorporates, than season with pepper, add the stock, bay leaf, cover and cook for further 3 minutes. Add the pasta and parsley mix well
Garnish with parsley and black pepper to serve

name: Courgette and cheese bake
method: Preheat the oven 200C/fan 180C /gas 6
In the large ball mix all ingredients, excluding butter, together
Grease the baking pot, and fill it with the mixture. Bake on the middle shelf for 30 min until golden on the top
Garnish with parsley and black pepper to serve

name: Beef Pilau
method: Heat oil in a large frying pan, add meat. Fry over high heat turning occasionally until evenly golden. Transfer meat to a large pot
Add carrots and onions to the pot, mix. Cook for 10 min over medium heat occasionally stirring
Add stock, cumin, thyme, salt and barberries. Mix well than cover and continue cooking for another 30 min stirring every 10 min

Add 1/3 of the water and mix well, add rise and flatten it with spatula. Than place a small microwavable plate over the rice and pur the rest of the water over the plate slowly. Cover the pot and cook at low heat for 20 min until there is no more water left above the plate
Take out the plate, and push garlic bulb in to the rice. Switch off the heat, cover and live to rest for another 10 min
Add parsley and mix well. Serve with cooked garlic cloves and freshly grated black pepper

name: Bacon and cheese aubergine halves
method: Cut aubergines in half lengthways(s), lay on the board skin side up and make lengthways slits, 1cm wide, 1 cm away from the stem. Transfer to the bowl and salt generously. Set aside for 10 min
Mix olive oil, crushed garlic and pinch of salt in the small bowl, set aside
Add cold water to the aubergines and leave for another 5 min till the water becomes yellowish. Drain well

Preheat the oven 200C/fan 180C /gas 6. Place aubergine halves skin side up on to greased baking dish, and start filling the slits with bacon, tomato and cheese slices. Spread infused olive oil over aubergine skin, and bake for 20 min
Garnish with parsley. Serve hot or cold

name: Coldynu or meat stuffed potato pancakes
method: Crush garlic in pestle and mortar (or press in to small bowl), than add warm water, olive oil and dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste, than set aside
In a small bowl mix minced meat, onion and seasoning
Grate potatoes and onion thinly, drain excess liquid. In a large bowl beat the egg, than stir in all the rest of ingredients

Heat a large frying pan over high heat, add oil. Form thin pancakes, around 4 inches in diameter. Shape meat filling in to thin patty, 2-3 inches in diameter and place it on the middle of each pancake, than cover the patty with potato mix. Fry on both sides until golden
Preheat 200C/fan 180C /gas 6. Transfer pancakes in to owen safe dish, drizzle with garlic sauce, cover and bake for 12 - 15 min
Serve with extra garlic sauce and soured cream on the side
